• Cost - Telegraph: An enemy familiar with your technique can rip it apart with ease. Those who don’t know your technique will catch on quickly.

• Physical: You pilot in a textbook fashion so that your wingmates know what you have planned.

• Social: At social functions, you address people properly and comport yourself as etiquette dictates, blending in while putting everyone at ease.

• Technical: Using standard parts and tools usually leads to desired results.

fade-to-black.name: Fade to Black
fade-to-black.desc:
“Sometimes the best way to beat your enemy is to avoid your enemy. Become nothing, and you become everything.”

With a slight and calm technique, you disappear into the background. You seamlessly merge into any environmental or social situation. No one seems to miss or notice your disappearance. This offers you time to investigate or hide. However, your position would become quite precarious if you were discovered.

• Benefit - Stealth: You or your work become difficult to notice. It may be carefully hidden or hiding in plain sight.

• Cost - Exposure: When you are hiding, you must move cautiously. During this time, you are unable to defend yourself if something were to move to attack you.

• Physical:You stick to the shadows to sneak by the guard. • Social: During an officer’s party, you try to blend in as one of the higher ranks to gather more information.

• Technical: You build the hidden camera so it looks like a common item.

keep-pushing-forward.name: Keep Pushing Forward
keep-pushing-forward.desc:
“Marines! They’re running low on ammunition, push through now! Charge!”

No matter the circumstance, you are able to get something done. However, it is an all-or-nothing endeavor. Once you start, you must push through to see the results, and they may not always be pretty. Use this Skill to assault a heavily guarded emplacement or turn a hostile mob to your favor.

• Benefit - Make Progress: Regardless of the situation, you make some amount of progress. You may be low on ammunition, have a heavily damaged reputation, or have few tools available for repair.

• Cost - Stubbornness: Once you start to take action, you are beholden to continue until the action has been completed. In many cases, this is dangerous; in a few, it’s dire.

• Physical: Despite this being your third sortie of the day, you still leap into the cockpit to defend your allies.

• Social: Despite the looks of doubt, you stick to your guns. You know you are right and will ultimately be vindicated.

• Technical: Bay after bay is filled with damaged Veritechs and Destroids. With a sigh and no end in sight, you pick up your tools. It will be a long shift, but you’ll get it done.

last-stand.name: Last Stand
last-stand.desc:
“We accept our fates, my Queen. As you order, we throw down our lives for the future of the Invid.”

You are backed into a corner. There’s nowhere to go and nothing left to do but give it your all in this last attempt at success. Use this Skill when the enemy has the drop on you, or you are pinned down with no escape.

• Benefit - Desperation: With nothing else to lose, you make one last attempt against all odds. This may be your last idea, missile, or a desperate speech to turn the tides.

• Cost - Consumed: In the effort, something is consumed or lost. An ally may be Wounded or killed, or a valuable item may become destroyed.

• Physical: In a one-on-one fight, you’re no more skilled than the next pilot. But surround you with enemies, and you fight like an ace.

• Social: When the argument seems lost, your conviction and eloquence shine through.

• Technical: The enemy is on its way, parts and ammo are low, and your crew is exhausted—yet somehow you have the Veritechs repaired, armed, and ready to launch.

treasure-hunt.name: Treasure Hunt
treasure-hunt.desc:
“I know where the old UEDF cache is, thanks to a tablet I took off a long-dead marine. They were just bones, but I got the tablet working.”

Finding buried treasure can make you rich, but it isn’t an easy task. It takes careful planning, dedicated research, and following all the right clues to uncover the riches of your wildest dreams. Use this Skill to uncover something hidden, lost, or forgotten. To use it to its full potential, you must have a clue or previously known information guiding your actions.

• Benefit - Uncover: After careful work and long hours, you uncover a long-hidden secret.

• Cost - Clues: To find the treasure, you need clues. You must be on the right track already or have previously received information.

• Physical: With study, you reveal details about enemy tactics that you can take advantage of when the battle arrives.

• Social: You have studied your business rival, but have just found the information that will take them down, giving you the lucrative contract.

• Technician: You uncover a special aspect of a long-lost technology.

valued-opinion.name: Valued Opinion
valued-opinion.desc:
“I’ve been there before. The Invid are vicious, but they can be defeated if we work together.”

Through expertise in a field, past performance, or good character, your opinions and thoughts are valued by your allies and sometimes even your superiors. Use this Skill to add weight to your ideas and plans. It enables you to provide your expertise to people who normally would not heed to your thoughts, such as a superior officer.

• Benefit – Sway: You have the ability to change people’s opinions.

• Cost – Expertise: You can’t just bluff—you must truly have expertise in the field in which you are expressing your opinion.

• Physical: Those above you will often take your tactical recommendations into consideration.

• Social: Friends and associates seek your advice about relationships, fashion or other personal topics.

• Technical: You are regarded as an expert in your field and are sought after for answers of a technical nature
